summary: API returning 500 on POST /api/v1/issues
comments: When creating an issue we get a 500 error. Trace id=abc123. Backend logs show NullPointerException.

summary: User cannot login
comments: User reports "cannot reproduce" on our side. Steps: enter credentials, hit login. No logs found.

summary: SLA breach reported
comments: Customer reports SLA breach, response time exceeded 30s multiple times.

summary: Service timeout spike
comments: Multiple timeouts (504) observed after deployment. Suspect upstream timeout config.

summary: Labels missing after migration
comments: Labels not migrated for some issues; occurs on bulk import. Attached sample payload.

summary: Payment gateway error 502
comments: Users see 502 Bad Gateway when hitting /checkout. Correlate with gateway traces.

summary: Fixed in commit 1234
comments: Issue resolved after hotfix, closing. Verified by QA.

summary: Assign to backend
comments: Please assign to @backend-team for investigation and debugging.

summary: Overview -------- Apigee is an API management platform for designing, securing, publishing, monitoring and analyzing API...
comments: Overview -------- Apigee is an API management platform for designing, securing, publishing, monitoring and analyzing APIs at scale. It sits in front of backend services as an API gateway / proxy, applying policies and flows so teams can change behavior without modifying backend code.

summary: Core Concepts ------------- - API proxy: lightweight facade in front of backend APIs. Proxies declare flows (Request/Res...
comments: Core Concepts ------------- - API proxy: lightweight facade in front of backend APIs. Proxies declare flows (Request/Response) and attach policies. - Flow: ordered sequence of steps (policies, scripts, service callouts) that run for requests and responses. - Policies: declarative building blocks used to implement security, mediation, transformation, caching, quotas and analytics. Examples: OAuth2, VerifyJWT, SpikeArrest, Quota, JSONThreatProtection, AssignMessage, PopulateCache, ServiceCallout. - Environment: runtime container where proxies are deployed (dev, test, prod, pay-as-you-go environment types). - Shared flows: reusable sequences that can be attached to multiple proxies for cross-cutting concerns (logging, auth). - Developer portal: portal to onboard API consumers, publish API docs, manage keys and product subscriptions.

summary: Policy Categories & Patterns --------------------------- - Security: OAuth v2, VerifyAPIKey, VerifyJWT, JSONThreatProtec...
comments: Policy Categories & Patterns --------------------------- - Security: OAuth v2, VerifyAPIKey, VerifyJWT, JSONThreatProtection — pattern: always authenticate incoming traffic first, then apply authorization and threat protection. - Traffic Management: SpikeArrest, Quota, ConcurrentRateLimit — pattern: protections placed early in flow to reject abusive traffic before heavy processing. - Transformation / Mediation: AssignMessage, ExtractVariables, JSONtoXML, XSLTransform — pattern: canonicalize requests early and canonicalize responses before returning to client. - Caching: PopulateCache / LookupCache / ResponseCache — pattern: cache safe GET responses at edge to reduce backend load. - Extensible policies: where custom JS/Java/Python is required (use sparingly; prefer declarative policies).

summary: Best Practices (from docs) ------------------------- 1. Use declarative policies whenever possible (less custom code → e...
comments: Best Practices (from docs) ------------------------- 1. Use declarative policies whenever possible (less custom code → easier maintenance). 2. Keep security policies near the start of the request flow. 3. Use analytics for baselining and anomaly detection before setting strict quotas. 4. Use shared flows for cross-cutting concerns (auth, telemetry, error handling). 5. Monitor latency and error budgets; protect backends with rate limits and circuit-breaker patterns (ServiceCallout + RaiseFault).

summary: Integration patterns for SPEEDYFLOW --------------------------------- - Protect JIRA integration endpoints via API gatew...
comments: Integration patterns for SPEEDYFLOW --------------------------------- - Protect JIRA integration endpoints via API gateway: apply OAuth/JWT, rate limiting and JSONThreatProtection. - Add a shared flow that logs ticket-related metrics (counts by status/assignee/priority) into Apigee analytics for dashboards. - Use ServiceCallout to contact ML microservice (ml_service) for real-time predictions in request flow (e.g., when creating/updating issues, enrich payload with suggested assignee/labels).

summary: Clarifying questions (to gather context) -------------------------------------- - "¿Puedes compartir el resumen y los pa...
comments: Clarifying questions (to gather context) -------------------------------------- - "¿Puedes compartir el resumen y los pasos para reproducir?" - "¿Este incidente afecta producción o solo un ambiente de prueba?" - "¿Hay SLA asociado a este ticket? ¿Cuál es la fecha límite?"

summary: Triaging language (friendly / actionable) --------------------------------------- - "Parece un problema de autenticación...
comments: Triaging language (friendly / actionable) --------------------------------------- - "Parece un problema de autenticación. Recomendación: (1) comprobar tokens, (2) revisar expiración, (3) reprobar con usuario de prueba. ¿Quieres que sugiera un comando o fragmento de log para buscar?" - "Sugiero asignarlo a @equipo-backend y agregar la etiqueta 'auth' — tengo una sugerencia de prioridad 'High' debido al impacto potencial."

summary: Workflow recommendations (next actions mapped to model signals) --------------------------------------------------------...
comments: Workflow recommendations (next actions mapped to model signals) ------------------------------------------------------------- - If comments contain "500", "timeout" or "504":   - Next actions: Check origin / backend logs → increase timeout on ServiceCallout → open high-priority ticket. - If comments say "can't reproduce" or "needs more info":   - Next actions: Request reproducible steps and sample payload; change status to "Needs Info" and tag requester. - If comments include "SLA" or "breach":   - Next actions: Escalate to ops, notify on-call, set SLA remediation steps, and estimate breach probability.

summary: Friendly closing / follow-up prompts ----------------------------------- - "¿Quieres que genere un comentario listo para...
comments: Friendly closing / follow-up prompts ----------------------------------- - "¿Quieres que genere un comentario listo para pegar en el ticket con los pasos sugeridos?" - "¿Deseas que programe una tarea para reproductions y asignación automática?"

summary: Useful patterns for tickets --------------------------- - Find HTTP 500 errors in logs: rg "\b500\b|\b502\b|\b504\b" ./l...
comments: Useful patterns for tickets --------------------------- - Find HTTP 500 errors in logs: rg "\b500\b|\b502\b|\b504\b" ./logs - Find SLA mentions: rg "\bSLA\b|\bbreach\b" -i - Extract trace IDs: rg "trace_id=([A-Za-z0-9\-]+)" -o

summary: - Blocker / Escalation: contains "blocker", "urgent", "stop", "production", "SLA", "breach".   - Action: set priority=Hi...
comments: - Blocker / Escalation: contains "blocker", "urgent", "stop", "production", "SLA", "breach".   - Action: set priority=High, assign to on-call, notify Slack, set SLA remediation.

summary: - Acceptance / Fix confirmed: contains "fixed", "resolved", "closing", "verified by".   - Action: move to resolved state...
comments: - Acceptance / Fix confirmed: contains "fixed", "resolved", "closing", "verified by".   - Action: move to resolved state, request QA verification, add resolution comment.

summary: - Actionable TODOs: contains verbs + assignee: "@john please deploy", "assign to".   - Action: create subtask, add check...
comments: - Actionable TODOs: contains verbs + assignee: "@john please deploy", "assign to".   - Action: create subtask, add checklist, set owner.

summary: Fields to extract from comments ------------------------------- - Timestamps and author (for timeline) - Mentioned ticke...
comments: Fields to extract from comments ------------------------------- - Timestamps and author (for timeline) - Mentioned ticket keys (e.g., PROJ-123) - Action verbs (deploy, rollback, investigate, reproduce) - Error codes and stack traces - SLA mentions and deadlines

summary: Recommendation engine mapping (example) --------------------------------------- - If (SLA mention OR "breach") AND prior...
comments: Recommendation engine mapping (example) --------------------------------------- - If (SLA mention OR "breach") AND priority != High -> recommend priority upgrade + immediate notification. - If (error codes 500/502/504) AND repeated across comments -> recommend system outage workflow: notify ops and create incident. - If (user reports "can't reproduce") -> propose reproducible steps template and set status Needs Info.

summary: How to integrate with `UnifiedMLPredictor` ---------------------------------------- 1. Use `predict_all(summary, comment...
comments: How to integrate with `UnifiedMLPredictor` ---------------------------------------- 1. Use `predict_all(summary, comment_text)` to obtain priority/assignee/labels/status suggestions. 2. Combine model outputs with comment-extracted intents to compute a recommended workflow: e.g., assign + escalate + set SLA remediation. 3. Store the suggested actions as a structured suggestion attached to the ticket (comment or custom field).

summary: Advanced topics & patterns ------------------------- - Problem detection & Davis: Dynatrace groups related symptoms into...
comments: Advanced topics & patterns ------------------------- - Problem detection & Davis: Dynatrace groups related symptoms into Problems; use Problems API to fetch correlated services, root-cause entities, impacted hosts, and timestamps. Example pattern: when ML comment-suggester flags a "timeout spike", query Problems API for correlating CPU/latency anomalies in the incident window and attach top 3 problem IDs to the ticket. - Traces and distributed context: Use the Trace API to retrieve individual spans and to map slow traces to service endpoints. Correlate trace IDs found in logs with Dynatrace traces to assemble a timeline. - Custom metrics & tagging: Push business metrics (e.g., ticket_count, sla_breach_count) to Dynatrace via the Metrics API. Use consistent tag keys (project, queue, environment) so dashboards and Davis insights group correctly. - Synthetic monitoring: configure synthetic HTTP/browser monitors for critical flows (login, checkout, API health). When a synthetic monitor fails, automatically create a JIRA incident with synthetic test details and link to the run. - Log analytics: forward structured logs (JSON) and use auto-extracted attributes. Dynatrace can link logs to traces and problems via traceId and entity IDs; ensure your log format includes traceId and spanId. - Alerting & remediation runbooks: attach a short runbook link (from docs/playbooks) to problems and add automated remediation steps (e.g., scale-up, restart service) using webhooks or Automations API.

summary: - Metrics ingest (push custom metric v1): 	POST /api/v2/metrics/ingest 	Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8 	Body fo...
comments: - Metrics ingest (push custom metric v1): 	POST /api/v2/metrics/ingest 	Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8 	Body format example: custom.ticket.sla_breach,source=flowing value=1 timestamp

summary: - Authentication: use API tokens with appropriate scopes (API keys created via Dynatrace UI). Keep tokens out of docs (d...
comments: - Authentication: use API tokens with appropriate scopes (API keys created via Dynatrace UI). Keep tokens out of docs (do not ingest credentials).

summary: Patterns for SPEEDYFLOW ---------------------- - Use OneAgent in staging/prod to collect traces and map slow transaction...
comments: Patterns for SPEEDYFLOW ---------------------- - Use OneAgent in staging/prod to collect traces and map slow transactions to tickets. - When comment patterns indicate "timeout" or "500", query Dynatrace Problems and Traces for related timestamps and attach summaries to the ticket. - Enrich tickets with Dynatrace problem IDs and URLs for quick investigation.

summary: Advanced SPL & operational patterns --------------------------------- - Efficient time-bounded searches:   Use `earliest...
comments: Advanced SPL & operational patterns --------------------------------- - Efficient time-bounded searches:   Use `earliest` and `latest` to constrain windows and speed up queries.   Example: index=app_logs "500" earliest=-15m latest=now | stats count by uri

summary: - Example SPL patterns:   - Top endpoints returning 5xx in last hour:     index=app_logs status>=500 status<600 earliest...
comments: - Example SPL patterns:   - Top endpoints returning 5xx in last hour:     index=app_logs status>=500 status<600 earliest=-1h | stats count by uri | sort -count   - Error rate delta detection (baseline):     index=app_logs level=ERROR earliest=-24h@h latest=now | timechart span=1h count as errors

summary: Useful SPL Patterns ------------------- - Search error rates in last 15 min:   index=app_logs level=ERROR | timechart co...
comments: Useful SPL Patterns ------------------- - Search error rates in last 15 min:   index=app_logs level=ERROR | timechart count by service span=1m - Find occurrences of HTTP 500 and top endpoints:   index=app_logs "500" | stats count by uri | sort -count - Correlate logs by trace id:   index=app_logs trace_id=abc123 | table _time service message

summary: Integration patterns -------------------- - For OTT providers: monitor mobile QoS (latency, throughput) per region and a...
comments: Integration patterns -------------------- - For OTT providers: monitor mobile QoS (latency, throughput) per region and adapt bitrate/codec accordingly. - For API integrations with carriers: use well-defined RESTful APIs (provisioning, billing) behind an API management layer (Apigee) with mutual TLS / OAuth and strict rate limits.

summary: Apigee (Google Cloud) is an API management platform that provides tools for designing, securing, deploying, monitoring, ...
comments: Apigee (Google Cloud) is an API management platform that provides tools for designing, securing, deploying, monitoring, and analyzing APIs. Core features include API proxies, API gateways, traffic management, security policies (OAuth, API keys), analytics, developer portals, and monetization.

summary: Key concepts: - API proxy / gateway - Security: OAuth2, JWT, API keys, traffic quotas - Analytics and monitoring for API...
comments: Key concepts: - API proxy / gateway - Security: OAuth2, JWT, API keys, traffic quotas - Analytics and monitoring for API usage - Developer portal for API documentation and onboarding - Policies for mediation, transformation, and routing
